Retaliation is a common practice by those in upper management so be advised.

review_title: Great Private Non-Profit School To Work!
job_title: Enrollment Specialist/Manager in Los Angeles, CA
pros: The school's mission is profound, getting minorities into the field of medicine. I was born in Watts, right across the street from the school in MLK hospital. They seek local talent both to work and to study. Benefits are great, management style is amazing, no micromanaging. The job is not dull, you do different tasks, go to local H.S Schools and colleges representing CDU, you advice prospects about programs and you give campus tours. The enrollment goals are achievable, they only have 3 semesters a year.  Not a boiler room, no minimum phone calls, you are truly an advisor here.  Most programs are capped.  If you consider yourself a hard worker you will thrive at CDU. Lots of parking and small campus.  A private non-profit university.
cons: Small school, mostly salaried positions, no overtime pay.  I have to deny admissions to good qualified students because most programs are capped off.

job_title: Administrator in Willowbrook, CA
pros: Free Food @ all events
cons: This is the worst place I have ever worked at!!! Feels like a start up company after 50 years. Current administration is solely interested in numbers and the façade of their strategic plan. Absolutely no one is interested in staff morale, adequate staff training, student success, faculty workload, steady growth, or some good ol student retention for crying out loud. CDU is seriously stuck in the 1950’s. I mean seriously. They still process paper employee timecards!!! Constant meetings held by the Provost are a total waste of staff time. The dude loves to hear himself talk. Nothing ever gets solves. Half of the university is made up of for profit people and the other half are folks who have never worked anywhere else. If you come from true higher ed turn the other way as fast as you can. This place cannot be fixed. Micromanaging, finger pointing, blatant incompetence, misuse of funds, blah!! What a mess of a university. They are desperate for numbers and are infatuated with self inflated job titles. Bunch of crabs in a barrel.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Los Angeles, CA
pros:
CDU faculty and administration truly care about the mission of the institution and the students who attend.  Class size is small and there is a lot of attention on serving the community and those with health disparities. 
The leadership at Charles Drew care about  the staff,  faculty and students. If there are any issues that are brought to the attention of faculty, and or leadership. Executive management will make a sincere attempt to quickly resolve those issues. 
There is a lot of Opportunity.  The benefits at CDU are great!
cons: Sometimes faculty and management care to much and there should be more accountability.

review_title: Fought the good fight for a good and worthy cause but became a casualty due to politics and poor leadership.
job_title: Program Coordinator in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Providing service to the underserved.
cons:
Highly political - it is all about who you know. 
Poorly managed - administration turnover is 2:1 in the almost nine years I was there.
Incompetence is rewarded - so long as it is passed-on and done correctly by someone else. 
Poor compensation & benefits - HR has a bad image within the institution.

job_title: Assistant Professor in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Small university, friendly people and it has potential...
cons: Bad management, lack of communication, poor benefits and salary. Horrible payroll services. It takes months to get salary fixed and if you work in research you need to wait weeks until your order is placed and when it arrives most of the time it was messed up. Orders are still done on paper and there is no electronic version. It can take days until someone replies to your emails. Bunch of lazy and incompetent administrative stuff.
